result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lorenzo Christopher

records.addlTxt:
11:02 AM Crt Comm: Timothy C. Heckmann, RPR: Unmonitored DAR, Clk: K. Anderson, Attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for State of Wisconsin, Defendant Lorenzo Christopher in court, in custody. INCLUDES 22CF738 (Set for PH) and 22TR3609. Court reviews file. DE does not qualify for public defender, filed PFAC but counsel has not been appointed yet. Court finds good cause to extend time for prelim to allow time for counsel to be appointed. DE requests bond modification. Court sets STC for attorney status. Adjourned: 11:06 AM. kma
Status conference scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on November 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
The original document was titled: Report
The original history event date is: 10-31-2022
Pretrial Assessment Report. Filed by JSC. Reviewed by SRN. SEALED. kma

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required be fitted with a SCRAM alcohol testing unit and further understand I am to submit to random alcohol testing at least THREE times per day. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.  I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. 

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

1:24 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: C. Dillon, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Lorenzo Christopher in court, in custody.  Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Lorenzo Christopher.  Prosecuting attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF738 & 22TR3609.  DE does not qualify for PD.  DE confirms address. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG to be entered on TR matter.  Bond argument.  Court orders bond and schedules next hearing. Adjourned at 1:27 PM. bph
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 4, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 4, 2022 at 11:00 am.
